Use your seedlings (channel points) to redeem a Code Review! Limit 4 total redemptions per stream. Choose one thing for me to focus the review on. The code / project must be hosted somewhere public. I work with JavaScript / Node.js daily, so the best reviews will be for those kinds of projects. I'm open to reviewing other kinds of projects as well.

The drop game is a game based on random chance in which your avatar or an emoji is flying across the screen until it's at the bottom of the screen. If you land on the grass in the middle, your name will be displayed on the screen. The closer you are to the perfect middle, the bigger is your name displayed.

Code Katas are small (but sometimes complicated) programming tasks ranging from 8kyu (very easy) to 1kyu (very hard), a lot having to do with maths or other sciences in addition to programming. They can be played on CodeWars. See !katas for links.
You can make the LEDs on the screen change state using "!led (8-digit binary number)". 1 is on, 0 is off.

CJ's editor of choice is Visual Studio Code by Microsoft, or VS Code for short. It is cross-platform, open-source (Note: Not Microsoft binaries.) and available at https://code.visualstudio.com/. See his settings here: https://github.com/CodingGarden/vscode-settings
To keep the chat easily moderatable, we enforce the English language in chat. There are some exceptions, for example if you have a good context.

CODING IMPROV. Building an app completely inspired / influenced by suggestions. Use your channel points to suggest something that will influence the code I'm writing. Limited to 10 total redemptions per stream. All suggestions are only suggestions and are open to interpretation.

I am building a Home Inventory Application. This project started with the goal of demonstrating database design. We have finished designing and creating the database and we are now creating a REST API to interact with the database. View the database model here: https://tiny.cc/sql-db-model View the code here: https://git.io/home-inventory-app View the past episodes here: https://tiny.cc/home-inventory-app
